title: 'Wonder Years' star Crystal McKellar lawyer undermine billionaire Peter Thiel's venture fund
text:
A former child TV star who ended up becoming a Harvard-trained lawyer is accused of orchestrating a letter-writing campaign to destroy a venture fund owned by billionaire Peter Thiel.

Crystal McKellar, 43, played Becky Slater on The Wonder Years in the 80s and early 90s, but after graduating from Harvard Law School in 2003 she went on to become in house counsel for a Texas venture capital firm.

McKellar allegedly tried to undermine Thiel's Mithril Capital Management by writing a number of inflammatory, anonymous handwritten letters to its investors.

Crystal McKellar, 43, a former child actor and lawyer for the firm is accused of spreading rumors after leaving Mithril Capital, a venture capital firm co-founded by Peter Thiel

Mithril Capital, is a venture capital firm co-founded by Peter Thiel, left, and Ajay Royan

The firm was set up in 2012 by by Thiel, 51, and Ajay Royan.

McKellar worked as the only general counsel of Mithril until February of this year and left the firm with a $225,000-a-year consulting gig, according to a suit filed this week in Texas state court, as seen by the New York Post.

After leaving, she is accused of immediately beginning 'a concerted whisper campaign to undermine Mithril, in which she would make false, anonymous complaints to Mithril's limited partners.'

In one letter, she accused Royan of 'lying to investors and the public about how much he is charging us in management fees.'

At the time, Mithril suspected the letters to be the work of 'a foiled plot by a self-serving ex-employee.'

Mithril had stated how the firm was charging appropriate fees which McKellar herself had signed off on, according to the suit.

McKellar is also alleged to have mailed letters 'written to sow discord between Mithril and its business partners.'

Sister, Danica McKellar, left, and Crystal McKellar, right, who both starred in The Wonder Years

Crystal, left, played Becky Slater in the show. Her sister, right, Danica, played Winnie Cooper. They are pictured here in 1991

Although the notes weren't signed, the envelopes sometimes contained a return address with the initials of the purported sender.

The initials allegedly 'caused more than one recipient to assume the letters originated from one of Mithril's more significant limited partners,' the suit suggests.

Bosses at the firm decided to employ the services of a forensic handwriting expert. They managed to identify McKellar as their author.

The findings shocked Mithril especially after the praise McKellar had given Royan before she departed the company.

McKellar wrote that he was 'a person of great personal integrity' who is 'brilliant at tech investing.'

But it appears that no sooner had McKellar left the company, within a month she began roles at three other venture capital firms, despite having signed a non-compete agreement.

The suit alleges McKellar attempted to 'solicit Mithril's limited partners almost immediately' claiming that her former firm was being investigated by US regulators.

The breach of contract suit seeks more than $1 million in damages.
description: Crystal McKellar, 43, a former child actor and lawyer for Mithril Capital based in Austin, is accused of spreading rumors to partners and competitors after leaving Peter Thiel's company.
